content:
The colors in Pollock's paintings are really striking, and I think that's part of what makes them seem so alive. I remember being particularly drawn to "Mural on Indian Red Ground" - the way the colors seemed to vibrate against each other was really captivating. And I also spent a lot of time in front of "One: Number 31, 1950", which is just incredible. The way the paint seems to swirl and dance across the canvas is really mesmerizing.

I think what really struck me about Pollock's paintings is how they seem to defy gravity - the paint appears to be suspended in mid-air, rather than being fixed to the canvas. It's like you can feel the energy and movement of his gestures as you look at the painting.
